title: Test Question 1 - HTML Basics
explanation: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language, which is the standard markup language for creating web pages.

title: Test Question 2 - CSS Selectors
content: Which CSS selector has the highest specificity?
explanation: ID selectors have the highest specificity in CSS, followed by class selectors, then element selectors.

title: Test Question 3 - JavaScript Variables
content: What is the difference between let and var in JavaScript?

options.text: let is block-scoped, var is function-scoped
var is block-scoped, let is function-scoped
let is for constants, var is for variables

explanation: The main difference is that let is block-scoped (limited to the block where it's declared) while var is function-scoped (accessible throughout the function).

title: Test Question 4 - React Hooks
content: What is the purpose of the useEffect hook in React?

options.text: To perform side effects in functional components

explanation: useEffect is used to perform side effects in functional components, such as data fetching, subscriptions, or manually changing the DOM.

title: Test Question 5 - Open Ended Question
content: Explain the concept of closures in JavaScript.
explanation: A closure is a function that has access to variables in its outer (enclosing) lexical scope, even after the outer function has returned.
